name: Kipling's Puck Walk Around the Bateman's Countryside, Batemans

ai.summary: Kipling's Puck Walk is a 7.9 km circular route around the Bateman's Countryside near Batemans in East Sussex, UK. The moderate-rated hike blends gentle woodland, hedgerows and open fields with scenic views of the estate and surrounding countryside. It's suitable for hikers with basic fitness who enjoy a peaceful, countryside circuit that can be shortened or extended with optional detours.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly well-defined dirt and gravel paths with grass tracks. Expect a mix of shaded woodland sections, hedgerow-lined field edges, and some open, grassy tracts. Surface can be muddy after rain and there are a few gentle ascents and stiles; require comfortable walking boots and possibly gaiters in wetter conditions.
ai.safety_notes: Check wind and weather conditions before setting out. Wear sturdy waterproof footwear and bring a lightweight waterproof layer. Stay on marked paths, observe any private-property signs, and keep dogs under control. Be mindful of livestock in fields, step carefully around gates and stiles, and carry a map or fully charged phone; in National Trust areas check access and opening details for Bateman's. Pack water and snacks and watch for mud or uneven ground after rain.
recommended_gear: Dry bag or Ziploc for electronics
ai.best_seasons: Spring, summer and early autumn (roughly March to October) offer milder weather and longer daylight. Be prepared for variable conditions — rain and mud are common in winter and early spring.
